title: Hospitals stop functioning as Israeli forces pound Gaza City
content: U.S. negotiators returned to the Middle East to continue cease-fire negotiations with talks in Cairo and Doha.
summary: U.S. negotiators returned to the Middle East to continue cease-fire negotiations with talks in Cairo and Doha.

title: Modi bear-hugs Putin in Moscow, marking deep ties between Russia and India
content: The visit shows India will maintain close ties with Russia despite Washington’s efforts to woo Prime Minister Narendra Modi and isolate President Vladimir Putin.
summary: The visit shows India will maintain close ties with Russia despite Washington’s efforts to woo Prime Minister Narendra Modi and isolate President Vladimir Putin.

title: NATO vows lasting support for Ukraine, but won’t promise membership
content: Admitting Ukraine into the alliance remains a contentious subject. Some NATO members fear absorbing a country mired in conflict with a nuclear superpower.
summary: Admitting Ukraine into the alliance remains a contentious subject. Some NATO members fear absorbing a country mired in conflict with a nuclear superpower.

title: Missile strike on Kyiv children’s hospital sparks call for more air defenses
content: Young patients were to be sent to Germany after a Russian missile strike on the Okhmatdyt children’s hospital, in which two people, including a doctor, were killed.
summary: Young patients were to be sent to Germany after a Russian missile strike on the Okhmatdyt children’s hospital, in which two people, including a doctor, were killed.

title: Fed up with tourists, Barcelona protesters blast them with water guns
content: Locals marched and delivered a manifesto on tourism’s cost-of-living impact, the latest backlash against a global travel surge since the end of pandemic limits.
summary: Locals marched and delivered a manifesto on tourism’s cost-of-living impact, the latest backlash against a global travel surge since the end of pandemic limits.

title: Another year of heat and floods spurs China’s climate-change awakening
content: Beijing has made adapting to extreme weather a policy priority, and weather officials issued an unusually direct warning about the intensifying heat and rainfall.
summary: Beijing has made adapting to extreme weather a policy priority, and weather officials issued an unusually direct warning about the intensifying heat and rainfall.

title: Russian missile attack kills 37 in Ukraine, hits children’s hospital
content: Among those killed in Monday’s attack were three children, said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.
summary: Among those killed in Monday’s attack were three children, said Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: With Orban in China and Modi in Russia, Putin’s multipolar world takes shape
content: As Hungary’s leader pushed for a Ukraine cease-fire, Russian missile strikes hit a children’s hospital in Kyiv and killed at least 37 across the country.
summary: As Hungary’s leader pushed for a Ukraine cease-fire, Russian missile strikes hit a children’s hospital in Kyiv and killed at least 37 across the country.

title: Thousands flee as Israel launches new Gaza City operation
content: As talks continued to sputter, Israel’s military moved into Gaza City in the north of the Strip, prompting widespread civilian displacement.
summary: As talks continued to sputter, Israel’s military moved into Gaza City in the north of the Strip, prompting widespread civilian displacement.

title: Playwright and director sentenced to six years in prison by Russian court
content: Theater director Yevgenia Berkovich and playwright Svetlana Petriychuk were arrested in May 2023 and prosecuted behind closed doors in Moscow over a play they staged in 2020.
summary: Theater director Yevgenia Berkovich and playwright Svetlana Petriychuk were arrested in May 2023 and prosecuted behind closed doors in Moscow over a play they staged in 2020.

title: A revived NATO marks 75 years, but political uncertainty clouds its future
content: President Biden hosts a celebratory alliance summit in Washington, but the specter of Trump and right-wing populism in Europe looms over the proceedings.
summary: President Biden hosts a celebratory alliance summit in Washington, but the specter of Trump and right-wing populism in Europe looms over the proceedings.

title: What to know about France’s leftist alliance after shock election win
content: The New Popular Front wants to lower France’s retirement age and vastly expand government spending on social welfare, environmental protection and health care.
summary: The New Popular Front wants to lower France’s retirement age and vastly expand government spending on social welfare, environmental protection and health care.

title: Divided France enters uncharted political territory after historic vote
content: While an alliance of leftist parties came in first, with more than 180 seats, it is politically divided and needs 100 additional seats for a majority.
summary: While an alliance of leftist parties came in first, with more than 180 seats, it is politically divided and needs 100 additional seats for a majority.

title: Copenhagen’s new sustainability push? Free coffee for tourists.
content: An initiative from Copenhagen’s tourism office offers perks like free coffee and museum admission for visitors who make eco-friendly decisions.
summary: An initiative from Copenhagen’s tourism office offers perks like free coffee and museum admission for visitors who make eco-friendly decisions.

title: How big elections are changing the world in 2024
content: Some elections are cementing the status quo. Others are shaking up the establishment.
summary: Some elections are cementing the status quo. Others are shaking up the establishment.

title: Is it cruel to cuddle a koala? Sanctuary stops hugs amid debate.
content: Taylor Swift and Pope John Paul II are among those who cuddled koalas at Lone Pine Sanctuary. But the Australia park abandoned the activity after visitor feedback.
summary: Taylor Swift and Pope John Paul II are among those who cuddled koalas at Lone Pine Sanctuary. But the Australia park abandoned the activity after visitor feedback.

title: In lawless Gaza, cigarette smuggling fuels attacks on aid trucks
content: The thriving underground trade is hampering aid deliveries as chaos and lawlessness grip Gaza.
summary: The thriving underground trade is hampering aid deliveries as chaos and lawlessness grip Gaza.

title: Ukrainian attacks on supply lines slowed Russians in Kharkiv, intercepts show
content: Russian troops invading Ukraine’s Kharkiv region are short of food and water, Ukrainian soldiers say, citing intercepted communications and interrogations of POWs.
summary: Russian troops invading Ukraine’s Kharkiv region are short of food and water, Ukrainian soldiers say, citing intercepted communications and interrogations of POWs.

title: NATO meets at a moment of peak uncertainty in the West
content: A sense of vulnerability and anxiety prompted by the rise of populist, far-right factions around the world looms over the upcoming NATO summit in Washington.
summary: A sense of vulnerability and anxiety prompted by the rise of populist, far-right factions around the world looms over the upcoming NATO summit in Washington.

title: France election: Far right’s rise suffers unexpected blow as left surges
content: Instead of ushering in France’s first far-right government since World War II, voters boosted the left and the center. But France may now face political paralysis.
summary: Instead of ushering in France’s first far-right government since World War II, voters boosted the left and the center. But France may now face political paralysis.

title: French election results a win for left and center candidates
content: The populist, anti-immigration National Rally party had been hoping to install France’s first far-right government since World War II, with 28-year-old Jordan Bardella as prime minister.
summary: The populist, anti-immigration National Rally party had been hoping to install France’s first far-right government since World War II, with 28-year-old Jordan Bardella as prime minister.
